text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

IRM was revised as follows: Description of Changes Retitled and added information to clarify when a prior closure by Appeals can be reopened. Retitled and added information for ERCS users Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.3.1 Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.7 Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.4 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2.4 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2.2 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.6 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2.1 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2 Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.9.2 Retitled and added information to identify a reopened record Retitled and included instructions for AIMS users Retitled and included instructions for ERCS users Added section and Included instructions for source code determination Added section, included instructions for reclosing reopened cases and impact on Exam tables Added section and included instructions for IDRS CC TERUP and QRACN
This IRM was revised as follows:

IRM Reference Description of Changes IRM 4.4.26.2.1 Retitled and added information to clarify when a prior closure by Appeals can be reopened. IRM 4.4.26.2.2 Retitled and added information for ERCS users IRM 4.4.26.2.3 Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.3.1 IRM 4.4.26.2.4 Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.7 IRM 4.4.26.2.5 Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.4 IRM 4.4.26.2.6 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2.4 IRM 4.4.26.2.7 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2.2 IRM 4.4.26.2.8 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.6 IRM 4.4.26.2.9 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2.1 IRM 4.4.26.2.10 Moved information to IRM 4.4.26.2 IRM 4.4.26.3 Retitled and moved information to IRM 4.4.26.9.2 IRM 4.4.26.4 Retitled and added information to identify a reopened record IRM 4.4.26.5 Retitled and included instructions for AIMS users IRM 4.4.26.6 Retitled and included instructions for ERCS users IRM 4.4.26.8 Added section and Included instructions for source code determination IRM 4.4.26.9 Added section, included instructions for reclosing reopened cases and impact on Exam tables IRM 4.4.26.10 Added section and included instructions for IDRS CC TERUP and QRACN
IRM 4.4.26, dated August 1, 2003 is superseded.
AUDIENCE
Large Business and International (LB&I), Small Business and Self Employed (SB/SE), Wage and Investment (W&I), Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TEGE) Employees and Appeals.

) When a case is reopened in the same fiscal year, the Exam Results are (
) deleted from the AIMS tables. If the case is reopened in a subsequent Impact on Exam Results year, the results cannot be deleted; therefore, the results will be netted the case is reclosed. (

) When a case is returned from Appeals, (even if the case has been to another Appeals Office), the database will automatically revert back to Exam office that closed the case to allow for the record to be deleted from ORIGINAL closing office’s AIMS tables. If the case is in an Appeals office is serviced by another campus, the case will automatically start the process to the closing office’s campus the weekend after CC AMSTUB input. Note: It is important to secure an AMDISA before the AMSTUR is input. Attach AMDISA to the inside of the case folder. This will help to ensure the amounts are reinput upon final closure.

) When a case is reopened in the same fiscal year, the Exam Results are deleted from the AIMS tables. If the case is reopened in a subsequent year, the results cannot be deleted; therefore, the results will be netted the case is reclosed. (

) When a case is returned from Appeals, (even if the case has been to another Appeals Office), the database will automatically revert back to Exam office that closed the case to allow for the record to be deleted from ORIGINAL closing office’s AIMS tables. If the case is in an Appeals office is serviced by another campus, the case will automatically start the transfer process to the closing office’s campus the weekend after CC AMSTUB was input.

X (Appeals) cannot be reopened. You must wait until the case ages off of AIMS before reopening the return. The case will age off AIMS after the third report extraction cycle after the case was closed by Appeals (approximately
months).
Note: It is important to secure an AMDISA before the AMSTUR is input. Attach the AMDISA to the inside of the case folder. This will help to ensure the correct amounts are reinput upon final closure.
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions
) Cycle time is computed from the original Exam Start Cycle until the final closing. on Cycle Time Example: The original closing has an Exam Start cycle of

months. If the case has aged off the AIMS the case cannot be reopened but must be established as if it were a new opening using IDRS CC AM

) Reopening a return affects the accomplishment tables of the Closing Business Code (PBC) office. How the tables are affected depends on on Exam Tables the return was reopened or returned from Appeals in the same fiscal year subsequent fiscal year. (

) If a case is reopened or returned from Appeals in the same fiscal year (this includes the extended fiscal year which ends after the November report in the Same tion cycle) in which it was closed into either status code
X or
, the Year closure is totally eliminated (deleted) from the closing PBC’s tables and the record is added back into the inventory tables. (
) AIMS retains the Examination Time, Cumulative Assessment Amount and Manual Assessment Amount from the original closure. All other accomplish- ment data is deleted from the AIMS record. Refer to IRM
for reclosing instructions. (

) If a case is reopened or returned from Appeals after the end of the fiscal year of the original closing, the original closure cannot be deleted in a the closing PBC’s accomplishment tables since the fiscal year tables have Fiscal Year been finalized. The record is added back into the inventory tables, and the record is counted again when it is subsequently reclosed. (
) All Prior Fiscal Year (PFY) AIMS information is stored on the history file the AIMS program uses to NET the figures when the reopened record is sequently reclosed. Refer to IRM
for reclosing instructions. (

Records 4.4.26
Non-examined closures do not require a waiting period prior to reopening.
There are two indicators that reflect if a return has been reopened or backed down from Appeals - the Reopening Indicator and the TC 300 Indicator.

The Reopening Indicator will be set when a return is reopened on AIMS. It remains set after the case is reclosed. The table below provides the definitions for the reopening indicators. This information is also contained in IRM 4.1.1, AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Introduction.

The TC 300 Indicator is set to a “6” if a return has been reopened or backed down from Appeals. The table below provides the definitions for the TC 300 indicators. This information is also contained in IRM 4.4.1, AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Introduction.

Indicator Definition 1 IMF/BMF Assessment 2 IRAF Assessment made against primary SSN 3 IRAF Assessment made against secondary SSN 4 IRAF Assessment made against both SSNs 5 The TC 300 indicator has been reset using CC AMAXU causing the return to appear on the Non- Assessed Closure Listing (NACL) 6 The TC 300 indicator has been reset using CC AMSTUR (a status code 90 case being reopened by Exam) or CC AMSTUB (case returned to Exam from Appeals)
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing
) The procedures for reopening a return on AIMS depend on whether or not return is still on AIMS. Records, (
) CC AMSTUR is used when closed examination records are in status
, still on AIMS. Complete Form
, Examination Update, and submit the AIMS according to local procedures. (
) Since input of CC AMSTUR generates a TC
to Master File but does generate a request for the return, you may request the original paper CC ESTAB following local procedures. (
) Appeals (status code
X) uses AMSTUB to update the status code to an Technical Services Status Code of
to return cases from Appeals to nation. (

) Returns that are no longer on AIMS (no AMDIS available) are not able to reopened. A request of this type is a “new” opening on AIMS. See IRM on AIMS AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Openings. (
) For Examination Return Control System (ERCS) users, controls may be requested using Form
-D, Examination Request, ERCS Users. Input Records, Form
-D reopens the ERCS controls only. Procedures for reopening depend on whether the return is still on AIMS. (

) If the return still has an AIMS record (AMDIS) the user will use the “Re- establish” option to regain control of the return in the group. This option AIMS not produce an AMSTUR. Therefore the group must complete Form
fax or e-mail the request to their local AIMS/ERCS analyst to re-open the controls.
Appeals (status code 8X) uses AMSTUB to update the status code to an Exam Technical Services Status Code of 21 to return cases from Appeals to Exami-
Note: The case(s) will be reopened on ERCS with all prior examination hours.
) If the return is no longer on AIMS (no AMDIS available) the user must a second exam using the “Request Tax Return” option. This will generate AM
or AMNON command code to establish the return on AIMS. (
) Charge-outs and labels are not generated when a return is reopened on Use CC AMLAB if labels are needed. (

) When reopening a return, you must enter the appropriate source code. following examples provide guidance for determining the source code. a. The return is on AIMS (AMDIS available), use the same source code as the original opening, unless the original closure was non-examined which case use an appropriate source code. b. The return is not on AIMS (no AMDIS available), use an appropriate (

reopening a return, you must enter the appropriate source code. The examples provide guidance for determining the source code.

) If you reopened the case in a reporting cycle after the cycle of the closure, you must wait until the end of the next reporting cycle before the return can be reclosed. This is to allow the original closure to be removed from the Exam tables. (

If you reopened the case in a reporting cycle after the cycle of the closure, you must wait until the end of the next reporting cycle before the return can be reclosed. This is to allow the original closure to be removed from the Exam tables.
Note: If using Report Generation Software (RGS), you must manually input the correct amounts.

from the original closing, the Exam Cumulative Assessment Amount (shown on page

4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing
For Audit Reconsideration cases, only use the original disposal code if there is no change to the original determination.
) The manual assessment amount is retained on the AIMS database. If addi- tional manual assessments were made after the case was reopened, re-enter Item
with the total of all TC
X adjustments. Even though you may be reversing the manual assessment by inputting a TC
, you still must enter the manual assessment or you end up with negative results rather than zero results.
The Amended Return Amount is not retained on the AIMS database, therefore, re-enter the amount from the original closure plus additional amounts if appli-
How the reclosure affects the tables depends on whether the reopening was in the same fiscal year of the prior closing or for a subsequent fiscal year.
How the reclosure affects the tables depends on whether the total examination results of the subsequent closure are more or less than the prior fiscal year’s
Records 4.4.26 page 7

The computer will NET the FY 2013 closure against the FY 2012 history file resulting in the FY 2013 table reflecting only $4,000 and 5 hours since credit was already received for the $10,000 and 10 hours in the FY 2012 tables.
Since we cannot reduce the FY 2012 tables after November, and we do not back out prior year results from current year figures, an amount of $0 and 5 hours would appear on the FY 2013 table.
IDRS Command Codes TERUP and QRACN are used to correct AIMS Exam results and prevent the transaction(s) from going to masterfile.

Note: IDRS Command Code TERUP allows an employee to delete his/her after CC TERUP/QRACN, erroneous entry on the date of input. See IRM 2.4.13, IDRS Terminal CCP/Campus Command Code TERUP, for additional information. Procedures

IDRS Command code QRACN is a quality review command code perform an action upon the transaction(s) being quality reviewed. The reviewer can accept, reject or review the specific transaction screen displayed. See IRM

, IDRS Terminal Input, Command Codes QRADDO, QRNCH, QRNCHG, RVIEW, QRACN, and QRIND for the Quality Review System, for additional information. The procedures to follow when reinputting the assessment, depend on the original input was a final closure (CC AMCLSE) or partial (AMCLSF). Since the case is in Status Code
X/
, the following steps are required order to reinput a long closure (CC AMCLSE) that was deleted by a CC TERUP/QRACN.
Reset the TC
Indicator to a “
” using CC AMAXU.
Reinput the Form
using CC AMCLSU -L.
If the AMCLSU is not input the same week that the TC
set to a “
”, the record will appear on the NACL. See IRM
, Procedures and Processing Instructions, Reports, for information on (NACL).
The procedures to follow when reinputting the assessment, depend on whether the original input was a final closure (CC AMCLSE) or partial assessment
Reset the TC
Indicator to a “
” using CC AMAXU. Reinput the Form
using CC AMCLSU -L. If the AMCLSU is not input the same week that the TC
Indicator was set to a “
”, the record will appear on the NACL. See IRM

4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions
AIMS Procedures and Processing (

) The computer must remove the amount that was “torn-up” by CC TERUP or QRACN from the Cumulative Assessment Amount field (which is one of the on Exam Results components that make up the Exam Results, page
of the AMDISA). This is done automatically when CC AMCLSU-L is input. The computer deletes the amount that appears in the “Last Amt Put in Cum” field (page
of the AMDISA) from the Cumulative Assessment Amount field and replaces it with the new amounts reinput. (
) The following steps are required in order to reinput a partial assessment that was deleted by CC TERUP/QRACN . AMCLSF

Reinput CC AMCLSF with the amounts necessary to reverse the deleted AMCLSF, IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWED BY CC TERUP OR QRACN. This is necessary to delete the original “torn-up” input from the Cumulative As- sessment Amount field.
Reinput the corrected CC AMCLSF. (

) The “torn-up” transaction is not automatically deleted from the Cumulative As- sessment Amount Field when reinputting a partial assessment. Failure to on Exam Results the above instructions will cause duplicate results.
